unnormalised: Tech Mahindra announced the appointment of Ms. Priya Sharma as the new Chief Innovation Officer (CIO) effective 01/11/2024. Ms. Sharma brings over 15 years of experience in the tech industry, previously holding the title of VP of Engineering at a leading Silicon Valley startup. The announcement was made by Mr. Anant Bajaj, the current CEO, during a press conference held at the company's headquarters in Pune.
normalised: Tech Mahindra announced the appointment of Missus Priya Sharma as the new Chief Innovation Officer (C-I-O) effective first november two thousand and twenty four. Missus Sharma brings over fifteen years of experience in the tech industry, previously holding the title of V-P of Engineering at a leading Silicon Valley startup. The announcement was made by Mister Anant Bajaj, the current C-E-O, during a press conference held at the company's headquarters in Pune.

unnormalised: The role of CIO is critical in today's rapidly evolving technological landscape. It is responsible for leading the company's research and development efforts, identifying emerging technologies, and driving innovation across all business units. Traditionally, titles like 'Director' or 'Manager' were common. Now, with increased specialisation we have roles such as 'Chief Marketing Officer' (CMO), or 'Head of Data Analytics' gaining prominence. The compensation package for Ms. Sharma remains undisclosed, but industry experts estimate it to be in the range of ₹5 crore to ₹8 crore annually, inclusive of bonuses and stock options.

unnormalised: According to reports, Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a renowned business strategist, commented on the appointment, stating that Ms. Sharma's expertise will be instrumental in driving Tech Mahindra's growth in the AI and cloud computing sectors. "Titles now define not only seniority, but area of expertise and responsibility", he noted. He further added that "New age companies need visionary leaders like her to stay competitive in the global market". The market responded positively with a jump of 2.5% in company stocks trading at Rs. 1250.50 per share, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) today.
